issue.message: Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in return type Function1<Double, Double> of 'getOetf'.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in return type Function1<Double, Double> of 'getEotf'.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in constructor Rgb has parameter 'oetf' with type Function1<? super Double, Double>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in constructor Rgb has parameter 'eotf' with type Function1<? super Double, Double>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in constructor Rgb has parameter 'oetf' with type Function1<? super Double, Double>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in constructor Rgb has parameter 'eotf' with type Function1<? super Double, Double>.
Use a functional interface instead of lambda syntax for lambdas with primitive values in variable 'outOfBounds' with type Function1<? super Integer, ? extends Boolean>.
issue.errorLine1: val outOfBounds: (Int) -> Boolean = { it < 0 || it >= positions.size }
